==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=くも}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=くも|-}}.  Found in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed in 759 CE.

Ultimate derivation {{unk|ja|nocap=1|sort=くも}}.  Various theories exist, including:

* From {{m|ja|籠もる|tr=komoru||to hide inside something}}, from the way that spiders hide in their webs
* From {{m|ja|組む|tr=kumu||to bundle something together}}, from the way that spiders wrap up caught insects
* From {{m|ja|雲|tr=kumo||cloud}}, from the way that spider webs may look vaguely like clouds

May ultimately be cognate with {{cog|ko|거미||spider}}. The kanji are {{juku|sort=くも}}, from {{der|ja|zh|蜘蛛|sort=くも}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|くも|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くも|クモ}}

# {{l|en|spider}}
#* {{w|ja:芥川龍之介|芥川龍之介}}, {{w|ja:蜘蛛の糸|蜘蛛の糸}}
#*: {{ja-usex|御%釈%迦%様は地%獄の容%子を御%覧になりながら、この犍%陀%多には'''蜘蛛'''を助けた事があるのを御%思い出しになりました。|^お-%しゃ%か-%さま は じ%ごく の よう%す を ご%らん に なりながら、この ^かん%だ%た に は '''クモ''' を たすけた こと が ある の を お-%おもいだし に なりました。|While observing the state of Hell, Shakyamuni recalled that this Kandata had once spared a '''spider'''.}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|ち|ちゅう|yomi=o}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=ちちゅう|蜘蛛|tr={{IPAchar|/ʈiᴇ  ʈɨo/}}}}.  Compare modern {{cog|hak|-}} reading ''tî-tû'', {{cog|cdo|-}} ''tĭ-tṳ̆'', {{cog|nan|-}} ''ti-tu''.  Probably borrowed at a different time or from a different dialect than ''chichu'' below.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ちちゅう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ちちゅう}}

# {{l|en|spider}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|蜘蛛の網|ちちゅう の あみ}}: {{l|en|spiderweb}}
{{der-bottom}}
